title: Cloudburst in Pakistan and India Causes Flash Floods, 185 Dead
snippets: The majority of deaths were recorded in Pakistan's mountainous Khyber Pakhtunkhwa area.
Disaster agency says the majority of deaths happened in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa in northwest Pakistan.

Search for the missing continues in north-west after downpour also sparks deadly flooding and landslides in India

A massive cloudburst has triggered flash floods in north-west Pakistan, killing at least 157 people, as rescuers continued to search for people missing after floods in neighbour
The country has endured heavier rain during monsoon seasons, which scientists have attributed to climate change. The authorities said that at least 194 people died on Friday.
titles: Flash floods kill nearly 200 in Pakistan and Pakistan-administered Kashmir

The incident also caused deadly flooding and landslides in neighboring India. Rescue operations are ongoing for those still missing. The region has experienced heavier monsoon rains, which scientists link to climate change. The total death toll reported by authorities on Friday reached at least 185.

titles: Human Rating and NASA-STD-3001
summary: Human-rating is a certification process ensuring space systems like orbiters, launch vehicles, and habitats are safe and suitable for human use. This critical validation covers design, reliability, and safety, confirming that these systems meet strict standards for human interaction in space missions.

title: NASA Astronauts to Host Space Call with Minnesota Students on STEM Topics
snippets: NASA astronauts Michael Fincke and Zena Cardman will connect with students in Minnesota as they answer prerecorded science, technology, engineering, and mathematics (STEM) questions aboard the International Space Station. The Earth-to-space call will begin at 11 a.m. EDT on Wednesday, Aug. 20, and w
titles: NASA Astronauts to Answer Questions from Students in Minnesota
summary: NASA astronauts Michael Fincke and Zena Cardman will engage with Minnesota students via an Earth-to-space call on Wednesday, Aug. 20, at 11 a.m. EDT. During this interaction, they will answer prerecorded questions related to science, technology, engineering, and mathematics (STEM) from aboard the International Space Station.

title: Exploring Damped Oscillators: From Guitars to Swings
snippets: A plucked guitar string can vibrate for seconds before falling silent. A playground swing, emptied of its passenger, will gradually come to rest. These are what physicists call "damped harmonic oscillators" and are well understood in terms of Newton's laws of motion.
titles: Physicists solve 90-year-old puzzle of quantum damped harmonic oscillators
summary: A plucked guitar string and an empty playground swing are examples of "damped harmonic oscillators," which slowly stop moving due to energy loss. These phenomena are explained by Newton's laws of motion, demonstrating how forces act on objects to gradually cease their motion over time.
